An Op-Ed is an article that expresses the opinion of someone not affiliated with the paper.&nbsp;&nbsp; You used active reading strategies in the mini-lessons <em>Previewing and organizing</em> and <em>Extracting key ideas and details </em>to get background information for your summary and to identify the article&#39;s main idea and key points.<br /><br />Now, you need to&nbsp;know how to identify and restate the conclusion.&nbsp; When you can identify the conclusion, you will better understand the writer&#39;s message to the reader.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"A diagram shows the three parts of a piece of writing. <span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">&quot;In conclusion&quot; is the signal phrase.</span></p><p><span class=\"marker\">To sum up</span>, there are many important characteristics of a good team member.&nbsp; <span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">&quot;To sum&quot; up is the signal phrase. </span></p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"4"},"leftText":"<p>The organizer from the mini-lesson <em>Extracting key ideas and details</em> summarizes what the Op-Ed is about and what the author thinks about it based on the first two paragraphs of the article.<br /><br />Together, these are the <strong>main idea</strong> of the Op-Ed.<br /><br />Remember the main idea has two parts:</p><ul style=\"padding-left: 15px;\"><li>It tells what the article is about.</li><li>It tells what the author thinks about this topic.</li></ul><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">From the Op-Ed organizer:</span></p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" height=\"200\" style=\"width: 100%;\" width=\"378\"><tbody><tr><td>What is it about?&nbsp; What is the topic?</td><td><p>Music programs in schools have been cut.</p></td></tr><tr><td>What does the author think about this topic?</td><td><p>The author believes that we should start teaching music again.</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p><br /><a href=\"S3_BUCKET_/CS6/2/Organizerwithsupport.pdf\" onclick=\"window.open(this.href, '', 'resizable=yes,status=no,location=no,toolbar=no,menubar=no,fullscreen=no,scrollbars=no,dependent=no,width=800,left=100,height=720,top=50'); Let&rsquo;s reopen that curtain and bring back the sounds of beautiful instruments&mdash;yes, even the tuba.&nbsp; The show must go on, and all kids should be seen and heard on the stage!&nbsp; Join us at an information session next Friday night to learn more about how you can be involved.</p></td></tr></tbody></table>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"6"},"leftText":"<p>You decide that it is the conclusion because the author restates the main idea and adds new information.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Main idea restated:</span></p><p>Schools are not offering instruction in music. Music should be put back into the curriculum.<br /><br /><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">New information added:</span></p><p>Citizens can attend an information session and get involved.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"7"},"leftText":"<p>The main idea and the conclusion are like bookends to a piece of writing.&nbsp; One introduces the writer&#39;s purpose and the other restates it.&nbsp;<br /><br />Together, they communicate to the reader the message the writer wants to share.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Main idea</span></td><td><p>Music programs in schools have been cut.</p><p>We should start teaching music again.</p></td></tr><tr><td colspan=\"2\"><p><strong>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; </strong><br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Body of the article<br />&nbsp;</p></td></tr><tr><td><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Conclusion</span></td><td>Schools are not offering instruction in music. Music should be put back into the curriculum.&nbsp; Citizens can attend an information session and get involved.</td></tr></tbody></table>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"8"},"leftText":"<p>To make sure that you understand the conclusion, first read it to yourself.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td>. . .The curtain is closing on children&rsquo;s music instruction in our town.&nbsp; It is a valuable subject and schools should bring it back.&nbsp; There will be an information session to learn about helping bring music back to the schools.<br />&nbsp;</td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Op-Ed organizer</span></p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td>What is the title of the Op-Ed?</td><td><p><strong>Town Music Shop Blows the Horn on Needed Music Education</strong></p></td></tr><tr><td>Who is the author of the Op-Ed?</td><td>Henry Schwinkle</td></tr><tr><td>Why is the author writing the Op-Ed?</td><td>He wants to convince readers that music should be taught in schools.</td></tr><tr><td>Who will read the Op-Ed?</td><td>Citizens of your town</td></tr><tr><td>What is the Op--Ed about?</td><td>A small girl, Tina Tully, stole and used several musical instruments over a period of several days. When she was caught, she told police she wanted to play an instrument, but was not given any opportunity to do this in the local schools.</td></tr><tr><td>What does the author think about this topic?</td><td>The author believes that Tina Tully stole the musical instruments because she could not learn to play an instrument in her school. He also believes that music should be taught in schools.</td></tr><tr><td>What evidence does the author use to prove his ideas</td><td><p>We have lost&nbsp; an important subject with the loss of music in school.</p><p>Music program was cut to give more time to academics.</p><p>Participation in music keeps kids busy.</p><p>Music helps kids understand the learning process.</p><p>Music requires teamwork.</p><p>Learning music helps kids learn other subjects.</p><p>&nbsp;Some kids stay in school because of music. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p></td></tr><tr><td>How does the author conclude or end the Op-Ed?</td><td>Music is currently not taught in schools in town. It is a valuable subject and schools should bring it back. There will be an information session to learn about helping bring music back to the schools.</td></tr></tbody></table>"}],"overviewHeader":"Overview"}
